result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Matthew J Schultz was found guilty of OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:58 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Kirk Everson.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Everson recites plea agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 as charged.  DA concurs.  DA moves to dismiss 2014TR1007.  Court dismisses 2014TR1007.  

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Statement by the Court, has received letters of support.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Kirk Everson.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

-120 days county jail with huber
-$1200 fine and court costs
-D.L. revocation for 4 years
-IID for 4 years
-AODA
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.


Court remands the defendant to the custody of the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Court adjourned at 4:09 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 5, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

1:51 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present with Attorney Kirk Everson.

Statement by Attorney Everson - defendant will be waiving his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives this right - Court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.

DA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Everson.  Attorney Everson confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties.  Attorney Everson enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.

Court directs matter be set for Status Hearing or Plea/Sentencing.

Court adjourned at 1:54 p.m.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Status hearing on September 15, 2014 at 01:15 pm. (Attorney Everson corrected himself, this is to be a prelim, not a status. Notice for Prelim will be distributed to parties)

8:30 a.m. Defendant present in court with Atty. Kirk Everson.  Special Prosecutor, Kyle Sargent for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Everson confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $2500 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court instructs defendant regarding his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for  status hearing in approx 30 days.

2014TR1007 Atty Everson enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  Matter to track with criminal case.
